definition: to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)
to keep up with/to catch up with/to overtake/to chance upon/in time for
to pursue/to chase after/to accelerate/to catch up with/to overtake
can't keep up with/can't catch up with/cannot overtake
to drive (vehicle)/to drive out/to chase away/to herd (people towards a gate)
to hasten on with one's journey/to hurry on
to go to market/to go to a fair

sentences.english: I commanded the voice before terror could incapacitate me.
sentences.chinese: 我赶在恐惧击倒我以前对那个声音下令。

sentences.english: The hecklers were conducted away from the hall at the request of the Chairman.
sentences.chinese: 主席要求把捣蛋分子强行赶出大厅。

sentences.english: And the percussion instruments are used in the "running boat" and "pushing boat".
sentences.chinese: 打击乐一般在跑船或赶船者推船时使用。

sentences.english: We had to abandon the car and walk the rest of the way.
sentences.chinese: 我们只好弃车，步行赶剩下的路。

sentences.english: The entire nation raised up and drove the enemy soldiers out from their homeland.
sentences.chinese: 整个民族奋起反抗，把敌兵从国土上赶了出去。

sentences.english: I must catch the nine-thirty train.
sentences.chinese: 我必须赶九点半的火车。

sentences.english: Let's go to the fair tomorrow morning.
sentences.chinese: 明天一早我们一起去赶大集吧。

sentences.english: He must have got up very early to catch the train.
sentences.chinese: 他一定起得很早去赶火车了。

sentences.english: The Lord your God will drive those nations out ahead of you little by little. You will not clear them away all at once .... Deuteronomy 7:22
sentences.chinese: 耶和华你们的神必将这些国的民从你面前渐渐赶出。

sentences.english: In order to catch the train, Tom got up very early this morning.
sentences.chinese: 为了赶火车，汤姆今天早上起得很早。

sentences.english: The success of the product led many companies to jump on the bandwagon.
sentences.chinese: 这一产品的成功使许多公司都来赶这个浪头。

sentences.english: Two hulking men bar the way, and T-Bag is ejected from the church.
sentences.chinese: 两个猛男挡住他的路，西奥多被从教堂里赶了出来。

sentences.english: We had hoped to catch the 9:30 train, but found it was gone.
sentences.chinese: 我们本来希望赶九点半的车，却发现已经开了。

sentences.english: With the help of two dogs, he drove the sheep down the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 在两只牧羊犬的帮助下，他把羊从山上赶了下来。

sentences.english: But that old horse kept pushing them out into the field.
sentences.chinese: 是那匹老马不停地将他们往外面的空地上赶。

sentences.english: Her new novel will be coming out in time for the Christmas sales．
sentences.chinese: 她的新小说将赶在圣诞节购物潮时发行。

definition: to expel/to oust/(dialect) to chase after/to try to catch up with
to hasten on with one's journey/to hurry on
that very night/through the night/for several nights in a row
to keep up with/to catch up with/to overtake/to chance upon/in time for
to go on a journey/to leave
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
variant of 奔[ben1]/variant of 奔[ben4]
to run like the wind/to rush/to gallop
